output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in advanced electrical engineering concepts, preparing you for more specialized studies and practical applications in the field.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Intermediate Electrical Engineering course! This course builds upon your existing knowledge of basic electrical principles and delves into more complex topics. Each module is designed to be concise and informative, with an estimated reading time of 2 minutes per module.

chapters.description: Advanced techniques for analyzing complex circuits, including nodal analysis, mesh analysis, and superposition theorem.
Understanding and applying Thevenin's and Norton's theorems to simplify circuit analysis.
Introduction to operational amplifiers, their characteristics, and basic configurations.
Applications of op-amps in amplifiers, filters, and other signal processing circuits.
Detailed study of diodes, transistors (BJTs and MOSFETs), and their characteristics.
Understanding and implementing different biasing techniques for transistors.
Introduction to digital logic gates (AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR) and their truth tables.
Simplifying digital circuits using Boolean algebra and Karnaugh maps.
Analyzing AC power circuits, including power factor, reactive power, and power factor correction.
Introduction to three-phase power systems and their advantages.
